name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. John W. QUARLES, Appellee

judges: Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. John W. QUARLES, Appellee.

opinions.text:
OPINION
PER CURIAM.
The petition for allowance of appeal having been improvidently granted, the appeal is accordingly dismissed.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Kenneth G. Biehn, Dist. Atty., Stephen B. Harris, First Asst. Dist. Atty., for appellant.
Peter N. Harrison, Doylestown, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
367 A.2d 1092
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellant, v. John W. QUARLES, Appellee.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Jan. 14, 1976.
Decided Jan. 28, 1977.
Kenneth G. Biehn, Dist. Atty., Stephen B. Harris, First Asst. Dist. Atty., for appellant.
Peter N. Harrison, Doylestown, for appellee.
Before JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
